sentence.Network_en: Some teachers enthusiastically espouse the benefits to be gained from educational software.
sentence.Network_cn: 有些教师热烈赞同可以从教学软件中得到好处的观点.

sentence.Network_en: People shelve the out - of - fashion moral icon and espouse the philosophy of egoism.
sentence.Network_cn: 搁置了人民的时尚图标和拥护道德哲学的利己主义.

sentence.Network_en: Today, astronomers espouse the theory that comets spawn the swarms.
sentence.Network_cn: 如今, 天文学家们支持彗星产生了流星团的说法.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'take as a spouse'): from Old French espouser, from Latin sponsare, from sponsus 'betrothed', past participle of spondere

entry.def: If you espouse a particular policy, cause, or belief, you become very interested in it and give your support to it.

example.ex: She ran away with him to Mexico and espoused the revolutionary cause.
example.tran: 她跟着他逃到墨西哥，并支持革命事业。

means.word_mean: 1. choose and follow; as of theories, ideas, policies, strategies or plans;
3. take up the cause, ideology, practice, method, of someone and use it as one's own;

sentences.en: The ideas she espoused were incomprehensible to me.
sentences.cn: 她所支持的意见令我难以理解。
